comments.author: emil-ripe@ripe.net
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-GB; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-GB; rv:1.8.0.6) Gecko/20060728 Firefox/1.5.0.6

Installed firefox-1.5.0.7.tar.gz but Help | About screen shows version 1.5.0.6.
This however looks correct: 
 $ /usr/local/bin/firefox  --version 
 Mozilla Firefox 1.5.0.7, Copyright (c) 1998 - 2006 mozilla.org

I'm typing this report from the just installed 1.5.0.7 but User Agent says 1.5.0.6.

Could be related to bug #333989


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. click Help | About
2. run firefox  --version
3. compare output



Expected Results:  
Help  | About version and firefox  --version should be consistent

Maybe update copyright year as well, says "1998-2005" now.

comments.author: emil-ripe@ripe.net
comments.raw_text:
My bad, this bug is INVALID..

I have an older version installed at /usr/bin from Ubunu packages and something got mixed up when running the latest from /usr/local/bin

  $ /usr/bin/firefox --version
  Mozilla Firefox 1.0.8, Copyright (c) 1998 - 2005 mozilla.org

  $ /usr/local/bin/firefox --version
  Mozilla Firefox 1.5.0.7, Copyright (c) 1998 - 2006 mozilla.org

After some fiddling around and restarting the browser, both say 1.5.0.7 in the Help|About screen.  Not sure if that makes it more consistent though.
